brewery.brewery_description: We brewed our first beer in early 2005 after the establishment of a 10 barrel brewery in the grounds of Thornbridge Hall. Our initial focus was on a range of cask beers that used traditional recipes but provided a modern twist through the use of a wide range of hops, malts and the innovation and passion of the brewing team. Now, with over 350 industry awards and a state of the art brewery and bottling in Bakewell, we're proud to be one of the leading craft breweries in the UK. Our beer now appears worldwide; initially it was only to Italy, but now over 35 countries worldwide, including our recent addition of Brazil, sell our brilliant beer. The increase in trade both at home and abroad has led to four expansions between 2009 and today.

beer.beer_description: A full bodied, robust porter with natural mocha malt flavours from the complex malt grist, complementing the decadent additions of real chocolate to the maturation process.
A velvety dark Nitro stout, exceptionally smooth and creamy stout with soft treacle flavours and a full body. Not as strong as some traditional stouts, but lacking none of their taste.

items.badge_description: While a pint of traditional English ale will always remain a staple, the craft beer scene in England, much like the rest of the world, has continued to grow at a rapid rate! That's 100 different beers from a brewery from England! Try 5 more for Level 21!

beer.beer_description: Leadmill IPA was created to celebrate the 40th anniversary of The Leadmill.

items.badge_description: Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 200 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower. Try 5 more for Level 41!
Had enough tea and biscuits? Head to the pub for a pint! That's at least 200 beers from the UK. Try 5 more for Level 41.

beer.beer_description:
8% Imperial Stout

The latest version of our Pardus series has come about by popular demand from our Beer Club Members. Sticky Toffee Pudding is a classic British dessert and is always a key feature on pub menus around the country. It’s an indulgent dish that we thought would work perfectly with our imperial stout. The toffee sweetness is delectable and well balanced with the roasted base of the beer and the classic date flavour is a great complement to the stone fruit flavours that this beer displays throughout. This is a perfect after-dinner extravagance

Hops - Bramling Cross
Malt - Maris Otter, Munich, Brown, Crystal T50, Wheat Malt, Chocolate and Black

items.badge_name: Dark Desert: Stout - Imperial / Double Pastry
items.badge_description: You've just tried one of three available styles from Style Hunt - Dark Desert week!

beer.beer_description: A full bodied, robust porter with natural mocha malt flavours from the complex malt grist, complementing the decadent additions of real chocolate to the maturation process.

items.checkin_comment: Advent #10: Standard classic wheat beer with bubblegum, banana and clove aromas and flavours.

beer.beer_description:
5% Wheat Beer 
 
This classic Bavarian-style wheat beer is hazy and true to style, bursting with effervescent flavours of clove, banana and bubblegum.

Hops - Tettnanger
Malt - Bavarian Wheat, Pale Ale, Cara & Pale Crystal

items.badge_description: It may not be cloudy outside, but your brew definitely is! That’s at least 5 different hefeweizens. Try 5 more to unlock Level 2.

If your mash uses more than 50% wheat, you’ve got yourself a wheat beer. This diverse family includes goses, hefeweizens, American wheat ales, and more! That's 10 different beers in the "Wheat" category! Try 5 more for Level 3!

beer.beer_description:
4% Hazy Pale Ale
 
Novi is a well-balanced beer inspired by the Novi Special 1940s racing car and the Novi Team engines developed in Novi, Michigan. Its colour scheme nods to Bobby Unser's ‘Novi Special’. The beer itself pours a delightfully hazy gold with a frothy white head, releasing punchy aromas of lemon, pineapple, and peach. The mouthfeel is decadent, with flavours of candied fruit and melon ensconced in a pillowy, creamy body, finished with just a touch of bitterness.

items.badge_description: It's time to give bottle shops some love by adding them as your purchased location. That's 55 check-ins with a purchased location! Tag 5 more to get to Level 12. Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast
Ahh, the trusty pale ale; crisp, refreshing, and always a good choice in a bind. That's 45 different Pale Ales or American Pale Wheats. Try 5 more for Level 10.

beer.beer_description:
Who better to brew an absolute stunner of a West Coast IPA with than Stone Brewing? Hailing from California, Stone have been creating amazing beers for nearly three decades and we are excited to create this beauty together.

It’s a classic West Coaster with all U.S. hops; powerful pine and grapefruit aromas pour forth from the glass, then the assertive hop bite leaps on to the palate along with flavours of tangerine and lemon. The robust malt keeps it in balance, leading to a long, bitter finish.

Hops - Centennial, Cryo Citra, Cryo Idaho 7, HBC 586 & HBC 1019
Malt - Low Colour Maris Otter, Wheat Malt & Caramalt

6% Passionfruit IPA
 
Music & Passion is a vibrant and refreshing IPA that beautifully blends theclassic citrus notes and intrinsic bitterness of a traditional IPA with thetropical allure of passionfruit. As your glass approaches, expect a cascade ofpowerful, fruit-forward aromas that create a delightful sense of anticipation.The flavours deliver on this promise, offering an uncompromisingly juicymouthfeel and a medley of fruit, culminating in a lingering bitter finish

items.badge_description: It's the final week! Week 4 wraps with the last 3 styles of this year's Year in Beer Style Hunt. You've just tried one of three available styles during the week.

items.checkin_comment: ‘Can we put that on the room please’. Bonus points for marks card. More free reviews, I love this time of year

beer.beer_description:
AM:PM is a truly sessionable beer that allows you to enjoy all the flavours and body of an IPA.
Bags of tropical fruit aromas, pineapple, guava tangerine and passion fruit are balanced with a chewy, honeyed malt character. Gluten free.
HOPS:Ella, Citra, Nelson Sauvin, Amarillo

items.badge_description: Had enough tea and biscuits? Head to the pub for a pint! That's at least 150 beers from the UK. Try 5 more for Level 31.

beer.beer_description: Our flagship beer has had a makeover to celebrate its 19th birthday! For this special batch we have added an array of dark malts to the brew to give this version it's unique look alongside the classic Jaipur flavours. It has been hugely fun to make and we hope everyone enjoys drinking it.

items.badge_description: Looking for more kick than a session beer, but want to be able to stay for a few rounds? You have to keep it in the middle. That's 95 beers with an ABV greater than 5% and less than 10%. Try 5 more for Level 20!

Canning is all the rage and it's not hard to see why - travels well, more environmentally friendly, and no need to carry your bottle opener. That's 30 checkins with the serving style of Can. Try 5 more for Level 7! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast
We believe in IPA and you should too. You certainly have a taste for the hops! That's 20 different IPAs. Try 5 more for Level 5! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

beer.beer_description: Light gold in colour. Lukas is a crisp, Bavarian style Helles. Hops: Hellertauer tradition.

Our flagship beer has had a makeover to celebrate its 19th birthday! For this special batch we have added an array of dark malts to the brew to give this version it's unique look alongside the classic Jaipur flavours. It has been hugely fun to make and we hope everyone enjoys drinking it.

items.badge_description: We believe in IPA and you should too. You certainly have a taste for the hops! That's 395 different IPAs. Try 5 more for Level 80! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

beer.beer_description: A full bodied, robust porter with natural mocha malt flavours from the complex malt grist, complementing the decadent additions of real chocolate to the maturation process.

items.badge_description: Looking for more kick than a session beer, but want to be able to stay for a few rounds? You have to keep it in the middle. That's 30 beers with an ABV greater than 5% and less than 10%. Try 5 more for Level 7!

beer.beer_description:
A citrus dominated India Pale Ale, its immediate impression is soft and smooth yet builds to a crescendo of massive hoppiness accentuated by honey. An enduring, bitter finish.

With over 100 worldwide awards, this American style IPA has a complexity of flavours created by a six-dimensional hop experience. 

Jaipur's hoppiness builds in the mouth and bursts with powerful citrus fruit flavours, culminating in a remarkably smooth finish and making it a deliciously drinkable IPA.

Hops - Chinook, Centennial, Ahtanum, Simcoe, Columbus & Cascade
Malt - Maris Otter

Named after the Green Mountains in Vermont, this beer very swiftly became one of the most popular in our range. We started to brew this as we moved into cans for the first time, knowing this would be a style well suited to this format. 

We pack this into kegs as well and it has become one of our key draught products, proving very popular on draught in the UK and across Europe. 

It has a light haze and soft body creating a very drinkable beer, we use a large amount of Australian and American hops to create a phenomenal bouquet of mango, pineapple and guava. 

Vegan Friendly.

Hops:
Galaxy, Mosaic, Citra, Amarillo

Malts:
Low Colour Maris Otter, Wheat, Caramalt
A full bodied, robust porter with natural mocha malt flavours from the complex malt grist, complementing the decadent additions of real chocolate to the maturation process.

Introducing Shelby, the official beer of the award-winning Peaky Blinders TV series.
Named after the infamous brothers, Shelby is a lovingly crafted English IPA, golden amber in colour with a nose of stone fruit and red berries, a gentle maltiness on the palate and a wonderful citrus, lemon-pith bitterness.

5% American Pale Ale
 
Chiron is our beautifully balanced American Pale Ale. We use a curated selection of classic US hops for their distinctive aromas of pine and citrus. These are added onto a foundation of the finest malt to give this beer an inviting light amber hue and a touch of caramel sweetness. Flavours of orange and peach dance on the palate before it culminates with a refreshing hop bite.

7.4% Imperial IPA

Light gold in colour, Halcyon is brimming with intense pineapple, grapefruit, lemon zest and piney hop flavours. Halcyon pairs perfectly with Roquefort, so its time to get the cheese boards out again.

AM:PM is a truly sessionable beer that allows you to enjoy all the flavours and body of an IPA.
Bags of tropical fruit aromas, pineapple, guava tangerine and passion fruit are balanced with a chewy, honeyed malt character. Gluten free.
HOPS:Ella, Citra, Nelson Sauvin, Amarillo

5.2% South Pacific Ale 

Kipling was the first UK beer to use the exquisite Nelson Sauvin hop from New Zealand. We brew this as a SMASH (Single Malt and Single Hop) using the heritage Maris Otter as a base malt which works to allow the complex flavour of this hop to really shine through. There is a grassy, grapefruit character on the nose, followed by passionfruit and mango. It finishes with a balanced and thirst-quenching bitterness.

Jamestown is soft in body and huge in character. Expect a bouquet of stone fruit and citrus, followed by flavours of papaya and pineapple on the palate.

Hopped with Galaxy, Nelson Sauvin, Citra and Mosaic with a malt bill of Maris Otters, Wheat, and Oat.
Light gold in colour. Lukas is a crisp, Bavarian style Helles. Hops: Hellertauer tradition.

Renamed from Raven to  Wild Raven in 2013 due to another beer of the same name from another brewery. 

The recipe for the brew came from James Kemp, now Head Brewer at Buxton Brewery. Previously crowned the New Zealand Home Brewing Champion in 2008 and winner of a Liberty Award, Kemp used Maris Otter, Black Patent and Chocolate malt along with Nelson Sauvin, Centennial and Sorachi hops.

The beer, called Wild Raven, has bitterness and hop character and plenty of malt flavours to give it complexity.

A 4.5% Hazy Raspberry Sour – For those that remember Tulameen, this is a newer version with more raspberries than ever! For those that didn’t know Florida Weisse is a style from over in America! This is a great sour, lip puckering and refreshing! 

Malt - Low Colour Maris Otter & Wheat

Single Hopped Citra Pale Ale

Crackendale explodes with a fantastic tropical fruit aroma, giving way to guava and ripe citrus which burst through on the palate with a beautiful bitter and sweet balance.

Hops - Citra
Malt - Low Colour Maris Otter

Our Bakewell Sour brewed in collaboration with Wild Beer Co. pours a golden yellow colour with a white head, the beer is refreshingly tart and dry with a combination of citrusy hops and flavours of grapefruit and bitter lemon.
 
The name Tart is inspired by the Bakewell delicacy where we are based and accurately describes the flavour of the beer in a single word.

Tzara is a hybrid beer, fermented like an ale but matured like a lager. A broad, almost fruity palate with some bready notes. A crisp, refreshing beer. Voted Best Kolsch Ale in Europe in the 2013 World Beer Awards.

Named after the new pub in York - The Market Cat.  It was brewed as a house beer to celebrate the opening. A creamy, rich porter with a floral hop flourish and mildly roasty aftertaste. Expect coffee and chocolate character.
A new beer to celebrate the 15th Anniversary of Jaipur. DDH Jaipur uses the same recipe but is double dry hopped creating an even punchier tropical fruit character.

4% Classic Bitter
 
Named after the aspiring Marples of Thornbridge Hall, this classic British bitter tastes of honey and caramel. A surprising smoothness is met with a long bitter finish.
Melba pours a light gold in colour and its peachy character is complemented beautifully by the use of highly aromatic US hops.

3.8% Juicy Pale

Astryd is a modern hazy pale ale packed full of US hops with a heavy focus on mosaic. This results in huge soft berry aromas followed by a wealth of stone fruit character on the palate to create a wonderfully flavourful experience at a low strength.
Wild Swan is white gold in colour with aromas of light bitter lemon, a hint of herb and a subtle spiciness. A great session beer!

Jaipur X uses all the same ingredients as our flagship IPA, Jaipur, but amped up to create an incredible Imperial IPA. It delivers an explosion of grapefruit and lemon in the aroma. The body brings the perfect balance which Jaipur is known for, with a light honey and apricot sweetness that works in harmony with the refined hoppy bitterness. The Strengthened abv adds to the complexity with a hint of navel orange and an enveloping warmth  on the finish.

Hops - Chinook, Centennial, Ahtanum, Simcoe, Columbus & Cascade.

Malt - Low Colour Maris Otter & Wheat Malt.

Rich and dark with smoke, subtle peatiness and the power of the dark malts. Molasses and liquorice and chocolate goodness all wrapped up in a smooth, warming liquid. Finishes with a distinct humming bitterness carried well by the hop and malt combo.

Brother Rabbit pours lemon zest in colour with a fresh citrus hop aroma. Bottle conditioned with our cask ale yeast, this beer is dry and fruity with a gentle bitterness, making it a great session beer.
Yelamu is a collaboration with our good friends at Magic Rock and is a powerfully hopped double IPA. Expect a ferociously full flavoured beer with a juicy character and well balanced body.
